txt.en: 'Taushakh will remember.'
'Attack now earth-foes in the name of the Great Eye!'
'Taushakh will not fall so easily!'
'That is not the end of the creatures, friend. More are upon us!'
'Whatever evil resides within the Gladdalf has disturbed even the trees!'
'The trail continues down to the east. Come!'
'These are unusually large tracks....'
'Come now, I feel our final foe lies ahead!'
'Well done! Thanks to your aid, Taushakh's service to Mordor was short indeed!'

'The Nazgûl vanished from my view, but he did not immediately depart. Legend tells that one of the Ringwraiths was an Easterling king who had great skill in tracking and stealth... only the dread that lay heavily upon my heart told of his presence. That now is gone, but the memory is black.

'It is good that you defeated Taushakh, for the Nazgûl had given him some power with which to rally the wood-trolls. In great numbers, they might have threatened Imladris itself! Individually, they are much less of a threat.

'We should return, [placeholder]. The Gladdalf grows cold and sad.'
'If you are ready to return to Imladris, I will go with you. We must report what has happened here, though the news be grim.'

'These tracks are unusual, [placeholder]. That they are the prints of wood-trolls cannot be denied, but they are too large even for those of their kind that walk occasionally within southern Mirkwood.

'Let us move into the Gladdalf, but cautiously. We are certain to find the trolls within.

'Stay alert! The wood-trolls will not have become organized enough to exert their influence without help, and there is still a Nazgûl somewhere in these lands.'
'The earth groans beneath the tread of evil, [placeholder]. There are wood-trolls near.'
'I am ready to proceed as well. The Gladdalf was a place of peace in earlier days, but now it is a den of evil, and I will be glad to leave it.'
Legolas has been defeated
'Come now... some beast calls the fen-crawlers. We must put an end to this creature if we are to continue following the tracks through Gladdalf.'
Legolas has been defeated
'The larger Wood-troll tracks lead to the west. Let us go!'

'I knew the moment you defeated the Caller of the Bog, [placeholder], for his command over the creatures of the fen suddenly abated.

'There is something still within the Gladdalf, for the evil that corrupts this place did not vanish with your defeat of the wood-troll that opposed us.

'There is something else behind this woe.'
Legolas has been defeated
'Well-fought, my friend! Let us gather our strength and press onward!'
'The earth groans beneath the tread of evil, [placeholder]. There are Wood-trolls near.'
Legolas has been defeated
Legolas has been defeated
Legolas has been defeated
Legolas has led the way deep into the Gladdalf, a remote corner of the Trollshaws, on the trail of the Wood-trolls.
'More foes are ahead!'
'These creatures are as persistent as their Mirkwood cousins!'
'A deep uneasiness lies about this place.'
'Never forget your new master. Pain comes to those who do.'
'Then prove your loyalty to the Great Eye! Deal with these foes, Taushakh.'
'Something evil dwells within these woods. I can feel it.'
'I leave them to you!'
'Did you hear that?'
'Look, to the north! More fen-crawlers!'
'Come to Taushakh, earth-foes!'
Aid Legolas
'Come, earth-foes! Rip and tear, gnash and gnaw!'

'Look, our foe lies ahead!'
Aid Legolas
Talk to Legolas
'The way ahead is barred by the trees and roots! We must defeat them!'
'Good,  now spare a few moments and rest, for the way ahead is fraught with worse perils.'
'Careful now, be on your guard!'
'I have read the signs aright, my friend! Look east. Wood-trolls!'
Legolas is following a mysterious trail into the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas of Mirkwood have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
Legolas is threatened by attacking wood-trolls in the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas of Mirkwood have followed the signs of the wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.

Legolas is threatened by droves of corrupted fen-crawlers in the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas of Mirkwood have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
'I have read the signs aright, my friend! Wood-trolls!'

Legolas has followed a mysterious trail onto an earthen rise surrounded by water in the centre of the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas the Elf have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
Legolas is waiting to speak with you.\n\nYou and Legolas of Mirkwood have followed the signs of the wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.

Legolas has followed a mysterious trail onto an earthen rise surrounded by water in the centre of the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas the Elf have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
'You have defeated a fearsome foe, but our search is not yet ended.'
Legolas is following a mysterious trail into the Gladdalf.\n\nYou and Legolas the Elf have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.

Taushakh, an enormous wood-troll, has gained the allegiance of his kind due to the favour of the Nazgûl.\n\nYou and Legolas the Elf have followed the signs of corrupting influence through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
'Look! The fen-crawlers rise up against us!'
'More are approaching from the west. Be ready!'
Legolas chased the Nazgûl as it fled and is waiting to speak with you.\n\nYou and Legolas the Elf have followed the signs of the Wood-trolls through the wilderness of the Trollshaws.
'Even the roots rise up against us!'
Unmarked Trail
Instance: The Unmarked Trail
'Some foul beast sends these fen-crawlers against us!'
'Come now, up to the north.'
